title: West Side National Park
text:
West Side National Park is a <a href="national%20park">national park</a> covering the western half of <a href="Andros%2C%20Bahamas">Andros</a>, <a href="the%20Bahamas">the Bahamas</a>, and the surrounding waters. The park was established in 2002 and, after being expanded in 2012, has an area of , being one of the largest protected areas in the region. The park is regarded as a <a href="marine%20protected%20area">marine protected area</a>, which includes <a href="tidal%20creek">tidal creek</a>s and coastal <a href="mangrove">mangrove</a> forest, as well as an expansive coastal zone.
Flora and fauna.
Inland, the park contains areas of <a href="Caribbean%20pine">Caribbean pine</a>, which provide habitat for <a href="Eumaeus%20atala">atala</a> butterflies. The mangrove areas include <a href="Rhizophora%20mangle">red</a>, <a href="Laguncularia%20racemosa">white</a> and <a href="Avicennia%20germinans">black mangrove</a>s, and <a href="Conocarpus%20erectus">buttonwood</a>. The park provides an important feeding area for the <a href="West%20Indian%20flamingo">West Indian flamingo</a>. The <a href="Cyclura%20cychlura%20cychlura">Andros rock iguana</a> is found on land, along with the <a href="Bahamian%20pygmy%20boa%20constrictor">Bahamian boa constrictor</a>, <a href="Cuban%20twig%20anole">Cuban twig anole</a>, <a href="Brown%20anole">Bahama brown anole</a>, <a href="Anolis%20smaragdinus">Bahama green anole</a>, <a href="Ameiva%20auberi">blue-tail lizard</a>, <a href="Leiocephalus%20carinatus">curly-tailed lizard</a>, and <a href="Cuban%20tree%20frog">Cuban tree frog</a>. <a href="Hawksbill%20sea%20turtle">Hawksbill</a> and <a href="green%20sea%20turtle">green sea turtle</a>s are found throughout the park, and <a href="Loggerhead%20sea%20turtle">loggerhead turtle</a>s inhabit the northern part of the park. <a href="Conch">Conch</a>, <a href="lobster">lobster</a>, <a href="bonefish">bonefish</a>, <a href="Atlantic%20tarpon">Atlantic tarpon</a>, the <a href="nurse%20shark">nurse shark</a>, the <a href="bull%20shark">bull shark</a> and the <a href="smalltooth%20sawfish">smalltooth sawfish</a> are found in the coastal waters.
